description: Use properties where resource-oriented access makes more sense than explicit operations. Properties hide calculation timing. Explicit operations when action is meaningful. Example: Get total value: Money (property); Submits for fulfillment: FulfillmentRequest (operation).

do.description: Use properties for resource access, explicit operations when action is meaningful. Example: Get total value: Money (property); Submits for fulfillment: FulfillmentRequest (operation)

guidance.description: Use properties when accessing resource state - hides whether value is computed, cached, or stored
example: Portfolio
Get total value: Money, Holding, MarketPrice (property - could be computed or cached)
Get risk score: RiskScore, RiskModel (property - timing hidden)
Get holdings: Holding (property - simple access)
Order
Get subtotal: Money, LineItem (property - hides calculation)
Get line items: LineItem (property - simple access)
(Properties hide when/how values are determined)

guidance.description: Use explicit operations when the action itself is meaningful or has side effects
example: Portfolio
Rebalances to target allocation: Trade, TargetAllocation (operation - action is meaningful)
Executes trades: ExecutionResult, Trade, Broker (operation - side effects)
Order
Submits for fulfillment: FulfillmentRequest (operation - action is meaningful)
Validates inventory: Boolean, InventoryService (operation - explicit check)
(Operations when the action matters, not just the result)

guidance.description: Choose based on whether caller cares about the action or just the value
example: Trade
Get execution price: Money (property - caller just wants the value)
Executes through broker: ExecutionResult, Broker (operation - action matters)
Payment
Get authorization code: AuthorizationCode (property - just wants value)
Authorizes with gateway: AuthorizationResult, PaymentGateway (operation - action matters)
(Property when value is the goal, operation when action is the goal)

dont.description: Don't expose timing details or use operations where properties make more sense. Example: Get cached total (wrong - reveals timing) vs Get total (right); Compute total (wrong) vs Get total (right)

guidance.description: Don't expose calculation timing in property names
example: Portfolio
Get cached total value: Money (WRONG: reveals caching)
Get pre-computed risk score: RiskScore (WRONG: reveals timing)
Get on-demand metrics: Metrics (WRONG: reveals timing)
(Should be: Get total value, Get risk score, Get metrics - hide timing)

guidance.description: Don't use operations when caller just wants a value with no side effects
example: Portfolio
Compute total value: Money (WRONG: operation for simple value access)
Derive risk score: RiskScore (WRONG: operation for simple value access)
Order
Calculate subtotal: Money (WRONG: operation for simple value access)
(Should be: Get total value, Get risk score, Get subtotal - properties for value access)

guidance.description: Don't hide meaningful actions behind property access
example: Order
Get fulfillment: FulfillmentRequest (WRONG: hides that submission occurs)
Payment
Get authorization: AuthorizationResult, PaymentGateway (WRONG: hides gateway call)
(Should be: Submits for fulfillment, Authorizes with gateway - make action explicit)
